node.title: 10 Historical Questions That Can Get You Arrested in China
node.description: Telephone and online hotlines allow citizens to report others who talk about these 10 "rumours."

node.title: New Volcanoes Could Emerge Anywhere In US Southwest, Study Says
node.description: Volcanic fields pepper the southwestern U.S., posing a risk of new eruptions that could cause widespread devastation.

node.title: Austria braces for violence at mass protests over Covid measures.
node.description: The police in Vienna said that 10 of 11 demonstrations registered for Saturday involved protests over rules including a newly announced lockdown and vaccine requirement.

node.title: Dog Hailed a Hero After Surviving Bullet in Head Confronting Armed Intruder
node.description: Gus has been made an honorary police canine after being shot in the head by a convicted felon in his Tennessee backyard.

node.title: Diving save ensures goalless Sydney derby, Tony Popovic gets winning start as Victory boss
node.description: A long-range strike from Wanderers' former England international Jack Rodwell nearly sends the boisterous crowd of 23,118 into raptures during the tight derby.

node.title: U.S. Tries to Convince Arab Allies It Isn’t Abandoning Them
node.description: The defense secretary faced tough questions about how countries were supposed to deal with a U.S. national security policy that upends itself with each president.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Lawyer Says 'There's Too Many Guns in Our Society'
node.description: Attorney Mark Richards told CNN's Chris Cuomo "I'm old enough when I remember you couldn't carry a gun."

node.title: Singapore will begin easing its Covid restrictions next week.
node.description: The Southeast Asian city state is recovering from a recent surge of hospitalizations. An official said its reopening would proceed in a “step-by-step manner.”

node.title: How to Get a Coronavirus Booster Shot in New York City
node.description: New Yorkers can get coronavirus vaccine booster shots at a number of places, including pop-up vans, churches, local pharmacies and community health clinics.

node.title: Inside Fentanyl’s Mounting Death Toll: ‘This Is Poison’
node.description: While a rise in overdose deaths shows the devastating consequences of the opioid’s spread, less is understood about how the drug has proliferated.

node.title: ‘When Are You Getting Married?’
node.description: The holiday season can sometimes lead to uncomfortable quizzing from meddlesome friends and family members about when you and your partner plan to wed. Here’s how to respond.

node.title: The Godmother of ‘Plant-Based’ Living
node.description: Frances Moore Lappé, the author of “Diet for a Small Planet,” which was published 50 years ago and spurred a movement toward vegetarianism, looks back on her legacy.

node.title: To Breed or Not to Breed?
node.description: In a world of pandemic chaos, political strife and climate catastrophe, some would-be parents see the future as too dark to procreate.

node.title: Career Coaching Today: Forget the Corporate Ladder and Find Yourself
node.description: The pandemic created a great reckoning among workers. Here to serve them is a raft of newfangled career coaches.

node.title: When Can the Covid Masks Finally Come Off?
node.description: Although the end of mask mandates is in sight, restrictions should remain in place through the holidays, experts say.

node.title: Family Unvisited, Travel a No-Go: The Hard Costs of High Gas Prices
node.description: They hit their highest level since 2014 last month, forcing Americans to rejigger household budgets and forgo leisure activities.

node.title: Allen Brooks, Victim of a 1910 Lynching, Is Remembered in Dallas
node.description: A historical marker will commemorate the intersection where a mob paraded Brooks’s body after he was savagely killed while awaiting trial.

node.title: One Historic Black Neighborhood’s Stake in the Infrastructure Bill
node.description: Generations of New Orleans residents have dreamed of the day when the Claiborne Expressway might be removed. President Biden’s $1.2 trillion infrastructure package could eventually make that possible.

node.title: Thousands rally against coronavirus restrictions in Australia.
node.description: Demonstrators gathered in cities around the country to protest vaccine mandates and other rules.

node.title: How Hunter Biden’s Firm Helped Secure Cobalt for the Chinese
node.description: The president’s son was part owner of a venture involved in the $3.8 billion purchase by a Chinese conglomerate of one of the world’s largest cobalt deposits. The metal is a key ingredient in batteries for electric vehicles.

node.title: Global Rivalries Are Miring the Clean Energy Revolution
node.description: The quest for Congo’s cobalt, which is vital for electric vehicles and the worldwide push against climate change, is caught in a cycle of exploitation, greed and gamesmanship.

node.title: Race to the Future: What to Know About the Frantic Quest for Cobalt
node.description: A New York Times investigation examines the global demand for raw materials as the clean energy revolution takes off. This is what we found.

node.title: Her Family and Pets Had Been Threatened, Said the Woman Who 'Ascertained' the Election
node.description: In this daily series, Newsweek explores the steps that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Says He Wishes He Hadn't Gone to Kenosha 'a Hundred Times Over'
node.description: Mark Richards, the attorney for the acquitted teenager, told CNN his client regrets going to the city the night he fatally shot two people.

node.title: Heavy rain in India leaves 17 dead, dozens missing
node.description: The southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh has been hit by intense torrents since Thursday, sparking massive floods in at least five districts, officials say.

node.title: Mega Millions Numbers for 11/19/21: Did Anyone Win the $74 Million?
node.description: A top cash prize option of $52.9 million was on offer on Friday but did anyone take home the big one?

node.title: North Melbourne's Ben Cunnington to undergo chemotherapy
node.description: Cunnington needs a nine-week course of chemotherapy, but the Kangaroos say he is expected to make a full recovery.

node.title: How Much Does Biden’s Spending Bill Actually Cost?
node.description: The climate change and social policy measure that the House just passed includes about $2.2 trillion worth of spending programs and tax cuts. But there are many ways to tally its price tag.

node.title: Mayor of Dutch city condemns protests that led to police firing shots at rioters
node.description: Crowds of rioters in the Dutch port city of Rotterdam torch cars and throw rocks at police after gathering to voice opposition to government plans to restrict access to indoor venues.

node.title: The flower giver: Spreading joy, one bunch at a time
node.description: A Tairua woman picked and delivered more than 300 bunches of flowers for people in her town in just two weeks with the sole purpose of spreading joy.
